adm:managed-object.name: file-based-key-manager-provider
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
provider accesses key information in a file on the local filesystem.
adm:managed-object.adm:description: Multiple file formats may be supported, depending on the providers supported by the underlying Java runtime.

adm:constraint.adm:synopsis:
The key store pin must be specified using one of the key-store-pin properties when the
is enabled.

adm:property.name: key-store-file
adm:property.adm:TODO: Should use a file-based property definition?
adm:property.adm:synopsis:
Specifies the path to the file containing the private key information. It may be an absolute path, or a path that is relative to the
instance root.
adm:property.adm:description: Changes to this configuration attribute will take effect the next time that the key manager is accessed.

adm:property.name: key-store-type
adm:property.adm:TODO: Can we restrict this to an enumeration? How can the client guess which values are possible? What is the default value?
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the format for the data in the key store file.
adm:property.adm:description: Valid values should always include 'JKS' and 'PKCS12', but different implementations may allow other values as well. If no value is provided, then the JVM-default value will be used. Changes to this configuration attribute will take effect the next time that the key manager is accessed.
